content: ophelia the octopus amigurumi helena shank for mrs shank designs samples crocheted with various different yarn types this pattern is easily adjustable for gauge meet ophelia the adorable crocheted octopus she s perfect for all kinds of yarn experiments use sock yarn for tiny ophelias or go for larger cuddly versions with thicker yarns make her sparkle for the holidays or try seasonal colors to match the time of year no matter how you customize her ophelia is sure to be a hit this pattern is crocheted seamlessly in the round worked in a continuous spiral for a neater finish we recommend using an invisible decrease for the base row and a yarn under single_crochet throughout to create tighter stitches these techniques are optional but will enhance the overall look while safety eyes are suggested felt or embroidered eyes are wonderful alternatives skill level beginner yardage / colours yarn paintbox yarns simply dk 100% ~45 yards for dk worsted & aran acrylic 302 yd / 276 m / 100 g ~30 yards for fingering alternate yarn stylecraft special dk hook 3 5mm for dk match hook size to 100% acrylic 323 yd / 295 m / 100 g yarn weight we recommend the following premier basic dk 100% acrylic 306 yds / 280 combinations m / 100 g 3 or 3 5mm for worsted yarn gauge not important for this pattern if 2 5 or 3mm for dk yarn there are gaps between the stitches after 2 or 2 5mm for fingering weight row 6 the gauge is too loose and a smaller hook is required notions stitch markers tapestry needle sizes finished size depends on type of yarn safety eyes used stitches & techniques long tail cast on increasing decreasing knitting in the round knitting flat stranded colourwork picking up stitches abbreviations single_crochet -
